review_text:
A lovely beach to visit in Newcastle. It was very choppy the day we visited but it was still spectacular to see the surfers do their thing and see the powerful waves crash to shore.
The bluff near the baths have interesting rocks to look at if you are interested in geology. Observed a few fossils and the rock pool great for kids.
A couple of parking spaces in the parking and along the street. Clean beach with a cafe at the edge and also lifeguards and surfers. Perfect to just sit and watch or to wet your feet.
What a stunning location - we loved the look out with the faux grass perfect for picnics - parking is more challenging but definitely worth  a visit
I lived here in 2022. This beach was really horrible. Superficial people, a beach destroyed by a disgusting beach club and a pub across the road full of superficial tossers.

review_title: Heavy Shore Breaking Waves made it Difficult to Enjoy the Surf
review_text: We visited this beach every day for a week. The shore break made it dangerous for anyone who was not good swimmer. Relief came from splashing in the wash. The facilities at the beach precinct are vey good, so a reasonably pleasant hour or two could be had here, but not so much in the water.
Excellent place for a walk and a swim. Was surprised there was so much parking available. Scenic and serene. One of the best parts of Newy
Bought lunch from Swell Kiosks and spent a few hours Merewether Beach watching our daughter playing with sand building. Such a beautiful spot.
I love this beach as do my family, beautiful clean beach and friendly locals. Def a must visit attraction and the bathes,

Don’t expect to come down here on a sunny weekend day and expect to park. Took us almost an hour to find a space. And that was just down to luck as we saw someone leaving. But the beach....wow.....it’s incredible.
Very busy beach area. The facilities were very busy as it was a nice day, but lots of toilets and showers. Still room on the beach. Stunning coastal walk along from Nobbys head

Visited Merewether Beach recently for the first time & it was lovely.  It is patrolled by life guards.  Parking isn't that great, there is no car park so need to find street parking.  The surf club is amazing with a restaurant and a cafe down on beach level.  Easy to stay for the whole day.

Merewether beach is a great example of a typical Australian beach. The water is clean and bracing and it is never really that crowded.

There is also a large ocean pool.
Easy to get a park, and the ocean baths were fantastic. Great for walking, swimming or dining. Scenic place
Lovely lunch at Merewether Surf House today, prawn pizza and a cocktail in the sunshine. Nothing better!

review_title: Walk the promenade and enjoy the view
review_text: There are actually 3 beaches here with one long promenade, Merewether, Bar & Dixon Park beach. Views of the headland are spectacular as you want the promenade. Plenty of places to stop for coffee or brunch as you watch the surfers.

review_title: One of the beat beaches in Australia!
review_text: From the beach to the wonderful ocean baths, Merewether Beach is amazing all times of the year. We’ve smashed out fitness goals in winter with that long set of stairs and cold water swims, to cooling off in Summer with a splash in the waves. Great to watch the coal ships go past and we always seem to see at least 2 aircraft. A busy and friendly place that we’d recommended visiting if you’re looking for a beach along the Newcastle coastline.

review_title: Such a Beautiful Beach and Ocean View
review_text: A visit to Merewether Beach is must if you are visiting Newcastle - around 2kms away from the CBD it is a lovely beach. Long stretch of beach and an amazing ocean bath and pools. Paved so you can walk on a path or better if you want to walk along the sand or along the water. Great place for families and the ocean baths have lots of spaces suitable for toddlers, little kids, youth and adult. Such a nice atmosphere and lovely cafe with good food selection and coffee. Can sit and enjoy the views all day here.

review_title: One of the best views on the East Coast
review_text: This has to be one of the best beaches on the east coast, great views, great surf and great coffee from the Blue Door Kiosk, Coffee with a View!
Enjoyed viewing the Baths and the beach was lovely, very crowded so very popular.  We had a lovely day in Newcastle and this beach added to our joy.  Enjoy
From Dixon Park to the other side of Merewether beach is  an easy walk with great views and two popular places to buy food and drinks.  Watching the morning sunrise on the waves is breathtaking.
Merewether Beach is awesome.  Well patrolled, clean and great for families as well as surfers.  It's home to some international surfing stars and locals love it too.
Merewether Beach wonderful. The baths more wonderful. Access 24 hours a day. Every day during hot days.
This is the best surf beach in Newcastle in my opinion,  free parking, restaurants and change rooms and great surf,  also great for dog walking

Combo of Merewether beach and bar beach are very nice. There’s some rock pools at the northern end. A cafe kiosk on the bar beach end and the mere weather surf house at southern end. Lots of parking (but does fill up) and a skate park across the road in the middle. Lots of families and it’s patrolled.

review_title: A great place for a swim
review_text: The Merewether Ocean Baths are a great place to swim.  Yep I am here again. They have an area for laps and a ramp for disability access. Ocean water fills the baths. They are pumped out and cleaned regularly. There is parking, public transport, a nice walking path, places to eat. A good place to visit.
Nice sand. There’s a pool spot for kids. Facilities available. Short walk into town for food.pretty beach.

review_title: gorgeous views at a popular summer beach for swimming
review_text: Part of a cruise ship shore excursion, this beach is popular with the locals,too. Dramatic backdrops for photo taking. Lovely  for strolling. expect high temperatures in December. Has places to eat, too.

review_title: Popular beach, great seaside walk too
review_text: Beautiful patrolled beach with lots of nearby parking. great place to take the family for a fun time. Lots of cafes nearby too.

I will keep it simple.. Merewether beach is a MUST DO if you are in Newcastle 👌

Clean, patrolled, lots to do and see and good food. Go here and make good memories.
Awesome beach, great boardwalk that goes for miles. Much hype and activity, uphill walk, skating, cycling, dogs, kids, couples - parks and playgrounds.

Visited Merewether Beach recently for the first time & it was lovely.  It is patrolled by life guards.  Parking isn't that great, there is no car park so need to find street parking.  The surf club is amazing with a restaurant and a cafe down on beach level.  Easy to stay for the whole day.

Merewether beach is a great example of a typical Australian beach. The water is clean and bracing and it is never really that crowded.

There is also a large ocean pool.
Easy to get a park, and the ocean baths were fantastic. Great for walking, swimming or dining. Scenic place
